Interpretation Methods¶

This section documents the interpretation methods available in the package.

LIME (Local Interpretable Model-agnostic Explanations)¶

class interpretation.LIME.LIME(model, X: ndarray, y: ndarray = None, comparison_method: str = 'one_vs_next', kernel_width: float = 0.75, n_samples: int = 1000, sampling: str = None)[source]¶

Bases: BaseInterpretation

Local Interpretable Model-agnostic Explanations for ordinal regression models.

explain(observation_idx: int, feature_subset: list = None, plot: bool = False) → dict[source]¶

Generate LIME explanations for a specific observation.

Parameters: - observation_idx: Index of the observation to explain - feature_subset: Optional list of feature indices to include - plot: Whether to plot the local coefficients

Returns: Dictionary containing: - higher_coef: Coefficients for higher class comparison - lower_coef: Coefficients for lower class comparison

The LIME class provides local explanations for ordinal regression models by approximating the model’s behavior around a specific observation. It supports different sampling methods:

  • None: Use training set samples

  • ‘uniform’: Sample uniformly from feature ranges

  • ‘grid’: Create equidistant grid over feature ranges

LOCO (Leave-One-Covariate-Out)¶

class interpretation.LOCO.LOCO(model, X, y=None, metrics=None, test_size=0.2, random_state=None, use_train_test_split=True)[source]¶

Bases: BaseInterpretation

Leave-One-Covariate-Out (LOCO) interpretation method for feature importance.

explain(observation_idx=None, feature_subset=None, plot=False)[source]¶

Generate LOCO feature importance scores.

Parameters: - observation_idx: (Optional) Index of specific instance to analyze.

Not used in LOCO as it’s a global interpretation method.

  • feature_subset: (Optional) List of feature names or indices to analyze.

  • plot: (Optional) Whether to create visualizations. Default is False.

Returns: - Dictionary containing feature importance scores and visualizations.

The LOCO class implements the Leave-One-Covariate-Out method for feature importance estimation in ordinal regression models.

Base Interpretation¶

class interpretation.base_interpretation.BaseInterpretation(model, X: ndarray, y: ndarray = None)[source]¶

Bases: ABC

Base class for all interpretation methods.

abstractmethod explain(observation_idx=None, feature_subset=None)[source]¶

Generate explanations.

Parameters: - observation_idx: (Optional) Index of the specific instance to explain. - feature_subset: (Optional) List of feature indices to include in the explanation.

The BaseInterpretation class serves as the base class for all interpretation methods in the package.
